member.name: T:InformationProtection.AuthDelegateImplementation
member.summary: Creates an authentication delegate, that is called by the SDK to get the entra tokens

member.name: M:InformationProtection.AuthDelegateImplementation.#ctor(System.Management.Automation.PSObject,System.Management.Automation.PSObject)
member.summary: Creates a new authentication delegate
member.param: The EntraAuth token for the Azure Rights Management
The EntraAuth token for the Microsoft Information Protection Sync Service

member.name: M:InformationProtection.AuthDelegateImplementation.AcquireToken(Microsoft.InformationProtection.Identity,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Give me a token for the requested resource!
member.param: The user that should be the source of the token. Ignored, since PowerShell assumes a single user connection per process.
The authority owning the token. Handled externally in the EntraAUth token and ignored here.
The resource we want the token for.

member.name: M:InformationProtection.AuthDelegateImplementation.GetAppInfo
member.summary: Return information about the application owning the token

member.name: M:InformationProtection.AuthDelegateImplementation.GetPrincipal
member.summary: Get information about the currently connected principal
member.returns: The currently connected principal (UPN or Object ID)

member.name: T:InformationProtection.ConsentDelegateImplementation
member.summary: Always say "Yes"

member.name: M:InformationProtection.ConsentDelegateImplementation.GetUserConsent(System.String)
member.summary: Ask whether it is ok (it always is)
member.param: Some Url we are going to ignore

member.summary: Get the latest token string, after making sure it hasn't expired

member.summary: Returns the user identifier of the associated token. Usually the UPN of the user or the object ID of the Service Principal.
